returndream: ^I let go of my master’s arm. He was not used to bleeding. We had returned. The smell of rotting organs filled the air. Our components were no longer fresh. Jack (blood, over the stench) groaned, and checked his watch.
jackstirs: ^“One week. Our preparations useless. Not even the wand.”
notmymaster: ^“We have the players don’t we, hound? The cave, the lodge, and ourselves. It must be somewhere on this island.”
creepinggrin: ^This was not my master. It didn’t know. The smell of the thing (sweat, yeast, decay) had been hidden by the rot. I could now see it wore my master loosely. A grin crept into its eyes.
^“You discovered another player while I was asleep? Interesting. Well, while I have the wheel I’ll need to see my colleagues”.

s: ^I watched as it opened the door, and left.

ihearabirdie: ^“I hate to see you all alone, dog. It seems it’s not your year”
^The bird had a gash across her back where my master had cut it. A mistake that had cost us dearly.

s: ^“My master has won every game before. He will win this one as well”
^“I don’t like being at a disadvantage”

c-0: ^“Perhaps” She replied “Although it seems he’s in two minds about it. Was he influenced by your trip to the other side?”
c-1: ^“No? Well maybe you’re playing for the wrong team. You’ve seen now what the world could look like if we let them through.”

s: ^“We’ve seen the dreamlands before. Being trapped there was no more pleasant”
^“Your world reflects this world. They won’t remake it in your image.”

c-0: ^“And yet you could feel it, couldn’t you. This world has no power left, it is—” She looks around “—a corpse. Is that why your master is so attached to it?
c-1: ^“Image? No. But there will be new power, new magic, new vitality. There's nothing in this world worth saving”

c-0: ^“Really? From what I've seen, the main thing he sees in humanity are intestines. Consider, has humanity ever given you reason to save them?"
c-1: ^“Your master? I don't think even you believe that, you've seen where he lays his head. Decide for yourself. Are these barren hills the best the universe can offer?"
c-2: ^“Ah, always the loyal servant. Well you may well get the chance to choose your master. If you do, think of what I said."

endofday1: ^With that, the cursed cuckoo flew away.
